item.description:
How about biking a new path? The South county bike path is a 13 mile round trip adventure going from the historic Kingston railroad station all the way to the heart of downtown Wakefield.

The path itself is scenic with lots of trees and nature (the picture with the goats was taken on our last ride on the path). There's a small section (roughly a block) that is on a quiet, residential street, but other than that and a few road crossings with lights, the path is all isolated from the flow of traffic.

There's also a highly rated ice cream shop at the midpoint of the path.

So come on and join us for a friendly ride this holiday weekend!
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be right in front of the train station, on the sidewalk. My cell #401-699-7304
item.name: Biking South County Bike Path + ice cream ~ 13 miles
